timeline.bodyText:
Not sure how I feel about having this as a system property.  On one hand, it does make some sense semantically, on the other those are typically "broker owned" properties that the service controls where sequence number is something the client controls.
I'm open to suggestion here, though...
timeline.author: jsquire
timeline.diffHunk:

         return systemProperties.getSequenceNumber();

+    /**
+     * Gets the sequence number that was assigned during publishing, if the event was successfully
+     * published by a sequence-aware producer.  If the producer was not configured to apply
+     * sequence numbering or if the event has not yet been successfully published, this member
+     * will be {@code null}.
+     *
+     * The published sequence number is only populated and relevant when certain features
+     * of the producer are enabled. For example, it is used by idempotent publishing.
+     *

+     * {@code null} if the {@link EventData} hasn't been sent or it's sent without idempotent publishing enabled.
+     */

+        return systemProperties.getPublishedSequenceNumber();

replies.bodyText: As per our discussion with service team, we should put this in system properties.

timeline.bodyText: Is this too specific?   Rather than tying it to the idempotent producer explicitly, maybe we should consider something like "requires sequence number" so that it can be used across features if needed?

timeline.bodyText:
Orthogonal to these changes, but this seems a bit different than how .NET does the estimation, which goes back to T1.    Not sure whether it's a concern, just mentioning for awareness:
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-net/blob/master/sdk/eventhub/Azure.Messaging.EventHubs/src/Amqp/AmqpEventBatch.cs#L137

replies.bodyText: Good question. then won't be reached if the send has an error.

replies.bodyText: published group id and published owner level are required to be set in the system properties (message annotation) of an EventData to be sent to the event hub service. But before the send is successful, we don't expose them. After send, they're exposed. A received event data also has them in the system properties if the event data is sent by an idempotent producer. So they're exposed to the users for reference, at least good for debugging.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

replies.bodyText: Can this be package-private for now to send the message and if customers need this information, make it public?
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: If this method is called twice - first time with a non-null map and second time with null map, then the 2nd call is a no-op and the builder will still use the first map which is not what the user would have expected. If the map is null, this builder's map should also be set to null.
timeline.author: srnagar

+     * If enabled, the producer will only be able to publish directly to partitions; it will not be able to publish to
+     * the Event Hubs gateway for automatic partition routing nor using a partition key.
+     *
+     * @return The updated {@link EventHubClientBuilder} object.
+     */

+     * The set of options that can be specified to influence publishing behavior specific to the configured Event Hub
+     * partition.
+     * These options are not necessary in the majority of scenarios and are intended for use with specialized scenarios,
+     * such as when recovering the state used for idempotent publishing.
+     *
+     * It is highly recommended that these options only be specified if there is a proven need to do so; Incorrectly
+     * configuring these values may result in the built {@link EventHubProducerAsyncClient} or
+     * {@link EventHubProducerClient} instance unable to publish to the Event Hubs.

replies.bodyText:
It actually means to set the producer group id in system properties but the user can't get it from anywhere. getProducerGroupId will return null.
After this event data is sent, the internal data will be surfaced via  getProducerGroupId.
Since this method name is confusing, I changed it to a more meaningful name setProducerGroupIdInSysProperties

timeline.bodyText: Does this part need to be in a mono? it seems ysnchronous to me.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Yes, without a Mono, it's too eager to have the Semaphore and may cause some problems.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: Since we're synchronising on the entire class... is it possible to just synchronise on the parts that need to be?
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Changed to synchronize on partitionPublishingStates.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: We don't need this. It's implied because there is no other variable with the same name in this scope.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Same with other usages of this
replies.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Removed.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: @srnagar I'm torn on using a semaphore for this. thoughts?
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText:
The requirement is for a combination of a producer group and a partition, the send should be sequential. No concurrency is allowed because the service will check the producer sequence number assigned by the client.
I spent long time in searching for a replacement of Semaphore for this use case. Any suggestions?
replies.author: YijunXieMS

replies.bodyText: The other option was to consider Reentrant lock but since the thread that acquires the lock may not be the same as the one that releases it, semaphore is the only option here.
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: You're doing this assignment in each iteration of the for loop?
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Oops! What a negligence. Updated.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: Do we need inSysProperties in these? It's an implementation detail. I just want to set the producer group, sequence number, etc on an Event Data, it doesn't matter to me where it is stored.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: I give it this specific name because setProducerGroupIdInSysProperties is internal and it doesn't set the value of property producerGroupId. After setProducerGroupIdInSysProperties is called, getProducerGroupId still returns null. After the event data is successfully sent out, the commitProducerDataFromSysProperties is called to set the value of producerGroupId and two other properties. Then getProducerGroupId returns the producerGroupId with a value. So I think setProducerGroupIdInSysProperties would be more specific and meaningful than setProducerGroupId when somebody else reads the code.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this class? I'm not fond of having utility classes unless it's constantly used by multiple classes. In this case, we are only incrementing by one.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: IIRC, we already have a constants class. Can we put them in there?
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Merged to ClientConstants and removed this one.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: private?
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Why p0?
replies.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Yes, should be private. p0 means partition 0. It's specifically for the initial state of partition 0. Since it's confusing, I changed it to partition0InitialState
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: Is there a test where we try a failure and it increments the count?
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Good question. I added test method sendEventDataListFail

timeline.bodyText:
You need to update your intelliJ settings not to use star imports. This will fail checkstyles. I updated mine to 99.



I am not a fan of this class... I don't see it providing enough value to warrant an entire utils class.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Corrected the import * and configured my IDE. Thanks
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: Can we also include some integration tests for this - maybe as a separate PR?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Service team will deploy this feature to all service bus namespaces in 3 weeks. Before that we might not have integration tests runnable. I manually did some test with a test service resource. So yes, we need to create a separate PR some time later.
replies.author: YijunXieMS
